qas.question: What is the refractive index of the ground?
What is the refractive index of air?
Besides a ground, what has these phases apply well to?

context: The phase of reflection of electromagnetic waves depends on the polarization of the incident wave. Given the larger refractive index of the ground (typically <a0_0>n=2<a0_0/>) compared to air (<a1_0>n=1<a1_0/>), the phase of horizontally polarized radiation is reversed upon <a2_0>reflection<a2_0/> (a phase shift of  radians or 180°). On the other hand, the vertical component of the wave's electric field is reflected at grazing angles of incidence approximately in phase. These phase shifts apply as well to a ground modelled as a good <a3_0>electrical conductor<a3_0/>.
